servinfo.title: Steering Column Assembly Removal and Installation

attention2.ptxt: Once the steering column assembly is removed from the vehicle, the column is extremely susceptible to damage.

Dropping the column assembly on its end could collapse the steering shaft or loosen the plastic shear pins which maintain column length leaning on the column assembly could cause it to bend or deform.
Any of the above damage could impair the column’s collapsible design.

When loosening steering column mounting bolts and nuts, make sure that steering column assembly and steering upper shaft assembly have been separated. Loosening them with steering column assembly and steering upper shaft assembly assembled could cause damage to upper joint and mounting bracket in steering upper shaft assembly.

attention1.ptxt: Never rest a steering column assembly on the steering wheel with air bag (inflator) module face down and column vertical. Otherwise personal injury may result.

attention2.ptxt: Never turn steering wheel while steering column with steering wheel is removed. Turning steering wheel more than about two and a half turns will break contact coil cable assembly.

s1.ptxt: Disconnect negative (–) cable at battery.
Disable air bag system referring to Disabling Air Bag System .
Remove steering wheel and contact coil cable assembly. Refer to Steering Wheel Removal and Installation and Contact Coil Cable Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove instrument panel under cover (1) from instrument panel.
(Immobilizer model)
Remove immobilizer control module (ICM) referring to Immobilizer Control Module (ICM) Removal and Installation . (if equipped)
Remove lighting switch referring to Headlight Switch (in Lighting Switch) Removal and Installation .
Remove washer switch referring to Windshield Wiper and Washer Switch Removal and Installation .
Disconnect connector from steering lock assembly.
For A/T vehicle, disconnect shift (key) interlock cable (1) from ignition switch with ignition switch turned at ACC position.
After disconnecting, turn ignition switch to LOCK position.
Remove steering upper shaft upper joint bolt (1) and nut (2).
Remove column support bracket. (if equipped)
Remove steering column assembly (1) mounting bolts (2) and nuts (3).

attention3.ptxt: Tilt lever should not be moved before mounting bolts and nuts are tighten completely.

s1.ptxt: Remove steering column assembly from vehicle.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Checking Steering Column for Accident Damage

attention2.ptxt: After tightening steering column assembly mounting bolts and nuts, steering shaft joint bolts should be tightened.

s1.ptxt: Be sure that front wheels and steering wheel are in straight-ahead position.
Align flat part “A” of steering upper shaft upper joint (1) with bolt hole “B” of steering column assembly (2) as shown in the figure. Then connect steering upper shaft upper joint.

Install steering column assembly (1) with contacting upper side of lower bracket slits to mounting bolts. Tighten steering column upper mounting nuts (3) first and then lower mounting bolts (2) to specified torque.

torqueitem.t-part: Steering column assembly mounting bolt and nut

s1.ptxt: Install column support bracket. (if equipped)
Install new steering upper shaft upper joint bolt (2) and nut (1). Tighten new steering upper shaft upper joint nut (1) to specified torque.

attention3.ptxt: Do not reuse steering upper shaft upper joint bolt and nut.
Be sure to use new bolt and nut when installing.

torqueitem.t-part: Steering upper shaft assembly upper joint nut

s1.ptxt: For A/T vehicle, connect shift (key) interlock cable (1) to ignition switch with ignition switch turned at ACC position.
And then turn ignition switch LOCK position.
Connect steering lock assembly connector.
Install washer switch referring to Windshield Wiper and Washer Switch Removal and Installation .
Install lighting switch referring to Headlight Switch (in Lighting Switch) Removal and Installation .
(Immobilizer model)
Install immobilizer control module (ICM) referring to Immobilizer Control Module (ICM) Removal and Installation . (if equipped)
Install instrument panel under cover (1) to instrument panel.
Install steering column hole cover (1).
Install steering wheel and contact coil cable assembly by referring to Steering Wheel Removal and Installation and Contact Coil Cable Assembly Removal and Installation .
Connect negative (–) cable to battery.
After installing steering column assembly, be sure to enable air bag system by referring to Enabling Air Bag System .
